00040 [scriptable, function, uuid(27bfbb84-ac22-46bd-b1bb-cf3baf6f3b3c)]
00041 interface sbICreateMediaListCallback : nsISupports
00042 {
00043   void onCreated(in sbIMediaList aMediaList);

00045 
00046 /*
00047 Class: Library
00048 
00049 A <Library> is a collection of <MediaItems> and <MediaLists>.
00050 It is possible to create a <Library> using the <Songbird::siteLibrary>
00051 function.
00052 
00053 Inherits:
00054   <MediaList> <MediaItem> 
00055 
00056 Example:
00057   (start code)
00058   //Create or get a library.
00059   var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00060 
00061   //Create a medialist using the library.
00062   var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00063 
00064   //Create some mediaitems and add them to the medialist.
00065   var itemURLs = ["http://path/to/song.mp3", "http://path/to/another/song.mp3"];
00066   for(var url in itemURLs) {
00067 
00068     //Calling createMediaItem may throw an exception when it fails
00069     //to create the mediaitem.
00070 
00071     try {
00072       var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem(url);
00073       mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00074     }
00075     catch(e) {
00076 
00077       //Dump it.
00078       dump("Failed creation of mediaitem: " + e);
00079 
00080       //Or alert it.
00081       alert("Failed creation of mediaitem: " + e);
00082 
00083       //Oops the URL was not valid.
00084       if(e.result == Components.results.NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG) {
00085         alert("The URL: " + url + " was not valid.");
00086       }
00087 
00088     }
00089   }
00090   (end code)
00091 
00092 See Also:
00093   <Songbird>
00094   <MediaItem>
00095   <MediaList>
00096 */
00097 
00109 [scriptable, uuid(a8193c8e-4f9a-4b31-ae7b-4f4ee07f4efb)]
00110 interface sbIRemoteLibrary : nsISupports
00111 {
00123   /*
00124   Group: Library Properties
00125   */
00126 
00127   /*
00128   Prop: scanMediaOnCreation
00129 
00130   Set this property to true if you wish all new <MediaItems>
00131   created to be scanned for metadata.
00132 
00133   Set this property to false if you wish to skip scanning
00134   for metadata when <MediaItems> are created.
00135 
00136   If you are attempting to set all of your own metadata for <MediaItems>
00137   you create, you may set this to false to prevent your metadata
00138   from being overwritten.
00139 
00140   Note:
00141     This property defaults to _true_.
00142 
00143   Type:
00144     Boolean
00145   */
00146   attribute boolean scanMediaOnCreation;
00147 
00159   /*
00160   Group: Library Methods
00161   */
00162 
00163   /*
00164   Method: createMediaItem()
00165 
00166   Create a <MediaItem> from a URL. You may pass in
00167   http and https URLs. Local file URLs are not permitted.
00168 
00169   Prototype:
00170     <MediaItem> createMediaItem(String url)
00171 
00172   Parameters:
00173     url - A URL referring to a media file.
00174 
00175   Returns:
00176     The newly created <MediaItem>.
00177 
00178   Throws:
00179     Invalid Argument (Components.results.NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG)
00180     if the URL isn't http or https.
00181 
00182   Example:
00183     (start code)
00184     //Create or get a library.
00185     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00186 
00187     //Create the mediaitem from a url pointing to a media file.
00188     var mediaItem = null;
00189 
00190     //This function may throw if it fails to create the item because
00191     //the URL is invalid.
00192     try {
00193       mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/file.mp3");
00194     }
00195     catch(e) {
00196       //Oops, bad URL.
00197       if(e.result == Components.results.NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG) {
00198         alert("Oops, the URL was not valid.");
00199       }
00200     }
00201     (end)
00202 
00203   See Also:
00204     <createMediaList()>
00205     <createMediaListFromURL()>
00206   */
00207   sbIMediaItem createMediaItem(in AString aURL);
00208 
00220   /*
00221   Method: createMediaList()
00222 
00223   Create an empty <MediaList> of a certain type.
00224 
00225   Prototype:
00226     <MediaList> createMediaList(String type)
00227 
00228   Parameters:
00229     type - The type of <MediaList> to create.
00230 
00231   Returns:
00232     The newly created <MediaList> or null.
00233 
00234   Note:
00235     Currently only the type "simple" is supported.
00236 
00237   Example:
00238     (start code)
00239     //Create or get a library.
00240     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00241 
00242     //Create an empty medialist.
00243     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00244     (end)
00245 
00246   See Also:
00247     <createMediaItem()>
00248     <createMediaListFromURL()>
00249   */
00250   sbIRemoteMediaList createMediaList(in AString aType);
00251 
00267   /*
00268   Method: createMediaListFromURL()
00269 
00270   Create a <MediaList> from a URL. The URL may point to an
00271   m3u, pls, rss or html file. After being created, the <MediaList>
00272   will contain all valid <MediaItems> it could create from the URLs
00273   it found in the file.
00274 
00275   Prototype:
00276     <MediaList> createMediaListFromURL(String url, Function callback)
00277 
00278   Parameters:
00279     url - The URL of the file to use for creating the <MediaList>.
00280     callback - The optional function that gets called when the load is complete.
00281                This function is passed a single argument that is the newly
00282                created list.
00283 
00284   Example:
00285     (start code)
00286     //Create or get a library.
00287     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00288 
00289     //Create the medialist from a url pointing to a file.
00290     library.createMediaListFromURL("http://path/to/file.m3u", 
00291       function(list) {
00292         alert("loaded " + list.length + " items!");
00293       }
00294     );
00295     (end)
00296 
00297   See Also:
00298     <createMediaItem()>
00299     <createMediaList()>
00300   */
00301   void createMediaListFromURL(in AString aURL,
00302                               [optional] in sbICreateMediaListCallback aCallback);
00303 
00312   [noscript] void connectToDefaultLibrary(in AString aLibName);
00313 
00320   /*
00321   Method: getMediaListByName()
00322 
00323   Get the site media list with the given name.  Note that to compare for
00324   identity one must compare the guid (instead of JS object comparisions).
00325 
00326   Note: 
00327     This method will not work with the main library, it is only for
00328     use with the Site Library.
00329 
00330   Prototype:
00331     <MediaList> getMediaListByName(String name)
00332 
00333   Paramters:
00334     name - The name of the media list to fetch
00335 
00336   Returns:
00337     The corresponding media list, or null if not found
00338 
00339   Example:
00340     (start code)
00341     //Create or get a library.
00342     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00343 
00344     //Fetch the shopping cart media list
00345     var mediaList = library.getMediaListByName("Shopping Cart");
00346 
00347     // comparisons for equality must be done on the guid
00348     var cart = library.getMediaListByName("Shopping Cart");
00349     alert(mediaList.guid == cart.guid);
00350     (end)
00351 
00352   See Also:
00353     <createMediaList()>
00354   */
00355   sbIRemoteMediaList getMediaListByName( in AString aName );
00356 
00357   /*
00358   Method: getArtists()
00359 
00360   Get a StringEnumerator containing all of the unique artist names in the <Library>.
00361 
00362   Prototype:
00363     StringEnumerator getArtists()
00364 
00365   Returns:
00366     A StringEnumerator containing all of the 
00367     unique artist names that exist in the <Library>.
00368 
00369   Example:
00370     (start code)
00371     //Create or get a library.
00372     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00373 
00374     //Get unique artists.
00375     var artists = library.getArtists();
00376 
00377     while(artists.hasMore()) {
00378       //The artist name (ie. "Justice")
00379       var artist = artists.getNext();
00380       
00381       //Do something with the artist name
00382       ...
00383     }
00384     (end)
00385 
00386   See Also:
00387     <getAlbums()>
00388     <getGenres()>
00389     <getYears()>
00390     <getPlaylists()>
00391 
00392 
00393   External Reference:
00394     Please see <http://www.xulplanet.com/references/xpcomref/ifaces/nsIStringEnumerator.html> for nsIStringEnumerator interface reference.
00395   */
00396   nsIStringEnumerator getArtists();
00397

00520   /*
00521   Method: getPlaylists()
00522 
00523   Get an Enumerator containing all of the <MediaLists> in the <Library>.
00524 
00525   Prototype:
00526     Enumerator getPlaylists()
00527 
00528   Returns:
00529     An Enumerator containing all of the 
00530     <MediaLists> present in the <Library>.
00531 
00532   Example:
00533     (start code)
00534     //Create or get a library.
00535     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00536     
00537     //Get all MediaLists.
00538     var mediaLists = library.getPlaylists();
00539 
00540     while(mediaLists.hasMoreElements()) {
00541       var mediaList = mediaLists.getNext();
00542 
00543       //Do something with the MediaList
00544       alert(mediaList.name);
00545     }
00546     (end)
00547 
00548   See Also:
00549     <getArtists()>
